data.name: FinancialInformation_01_Title
data.value: What is the financial year end date for the information you uploaded?

data.name: FinancialInformation_02_Title
data.value: Upload your organisation's accounts or financial statements

data.name: FinancialInformation_02_Description
data.value:
Your most recent two financial years, or your most recent financial year if you do not have two years.

If you do not have a full year of accounts, upload a statement showing your organisation's financial standing.

data.name: FinancialInformation_03_Description
data.value: Auditing requirements are defined in part 16 of the Companies Act 2006 (opens in new tab) or an overseas equivalent

data.name: FinancialInformation_04_Description
data.value:
You'll need to upload accounts or statements for your organisation's most recent two financial years, or your most recent financial year if you do not have two years.

If you do not have a full year of accounts, you can upload a statement showing your organisation's financial standing.

You'll need to enter the financial year end date for the information you upload.

data.name: FinancialInformation_Configuration_RemoveConfirmationHeading
data.value: Are you sure you want to remove this file?

data.name: Qualifications_01_Description
data.value: Enter one qualification at a time. You can add another at the end if you need to. For example, ISO 45001 Health and Safety Management.

data.name: Qualifications_02_Description
data.value: Enter the name of the person or body. For example, ISO or Constructionline.

data.name: Qualifications_03_Title
data.value: What date was the qualification awarded?

data.name: Qualifications_Configuration_RemoveConfirmationHeading
data.value: Are you sure you want to remove this qualification?

data.name: Qualifications_Configuration_FurtherQuestionsExemptedHint
data.value: These are general qualifications for business and trade, not procurement specific. Adding them will provide evidence of your suitability to contracting authorities and support any bids you submit. For example, ISO certification.

data.name: Qualifications_Configuration_FurtherQuestionsExemptedHeading
data.value: Do you want to add any relevant qualifications?

data.name: CyberEssentials_01_Title
data.value: Submitting your Cyber Essentials certification scheme information

data.name: CyberEssentials_01_Description
data.value:
The Cyber Essentials certification scheme is a UK government initiative that helps organisations protect themselves from common cyber threats. This certification reduces risks in the supply chain and is important for building trust in government contracts. The contracting authority you are bidding for will tell you which certification you need. For more information read PPN 014: Cyber Essentials scheme (opens in a new tab).

You are only required to complete this module if requested by the contracting authority you are bidding for. Failure to complete this module may result in your tenders being deemed insufficient where PPN 014 has been applied.

The information you'll need

You'll need to provide information on your Cyber Essentials or Cyber Essentials Plus certification (or equivalent). This may include:
  • confirmation that you meet the requirements of the certification scheme
  • the expiry date of your certification
  • evidence of your certification

data.name: CyberEssentials_02_Title
data.value: Do you meet the Cyber Essentials certification requirements?

data.name: CyberEssentials_02_CustomYesText
data.value: Yes, I meet the requirements or will meet them by contract award

data.name: CyberEssentials_02_CustomNoText
data.value: No, I do not meet the requirements

data.name: CyberEssentials_02_CustomInsetText
data.value: You must be ready to provide evidence, if required, before the contract is awarded.

data.name: CyberEssentials_03_Title
data.value: When will you meet the Cyber Essentials certification requirements?

data.name: CyberEssentials_03_CustomNoText
data.value: I do not currently meet the requirements, but will meet them by contract award

data.name: CyberEssentials_04_Title
data.value: Upload evidence of your Cyber Essentials certification (or equivalent)

data.name: CyberEssentials_05_Title
data.value: Enter the expiry date of your Cyber Essentials certification (or equivalent)

data.name: CyberEssentials_06_Title
data.value: Do you meet the Cyber Essentials Plus certification requirements?

data.name: CyberEssentials_06_CustomYesText
data.value: Yes, I meet the requirements or will meet them by contract award

data.name: CyberEssentials_06_CustomNoText
data.value: No, I do not meet the requirements

data.name: CyberEssentials_06_CustomInsetText
data.value: You must be ready to provide evidence, if required, before the contract is awarded.

data.name: CyberEssentials_07_Title
data.value: When will you meet the Cyber Essentials Plus certification requirements?

data.name: CyberEssentials_07_CustomNoText
data.value: I do not currently meet the requirements, but will meet them by contract award

data.name: CyberEssentials_08_Title
data.value: Upload evidence of your Cyber Essentials Plus certification (or equivalent)

data.name: CyberEssentials_09_Title
data.value: Enter the expiry date of your Cyber Essentials Plus certification (or equivalent)

data.name: Steel_Configuration_FurtherQuestionsExemptedHint
data.value: You'll need to provide information on steel specific supply chain projects or programmes. This may include relevant examples of:

data.name: SteelQuestion_01_Description
data.value:
This module refers to the procurement and use of steel products in government projects. It focuses on compliance with UK regulations regarding sourcing, quality, and sustainability. For further information read PPN 010: Revised guidance on procuring steel in government contracts (opens in new tab).

You are only required to complete this module if requested by the contracting authority you are bidding for. Failure to complete this module may result in your tenders being deemed insufficient where PPN 010 has been applied.

The information you'll need

You'll need to provide information on steel specific supply chain projects or programmes. This may include relevant examples of:

  • management systems, policies, standards and procedures
  • sustainable practice
  • health and safety breaches

data.name: SteelQuestion_02_Title
data.value: Supply chain management in steel procurement

data.name: SteelQuestion_02_Description
data.value:
Where relevant, give details of steel projects or programmes where you have shown:

  • effective management of your steel supply chain systems, policies, standards and procedures
  • compliance with relevant legislation
  • sustainable steel supply (including your supply chain)
  • management of health and safety breaches in the last 5 years, in the country where you work, for your organisation and supply chain members
What is sustainable steel supply?
Sustainable supply of steel refers to the sourcing and production of steel that is environmentally, socially and economically responsible. It involves practices that limit environmental impact, such as reducing carbon emissions whilst ensuring fair labour practices and supporting local communities.

If you would like to provide this information in a document format, enter “not applicable” below and continue to the next question

data.name: SteelQuestion_03_Title
data.value: Do you have supporting documents to upload?

data.name: QualityManagementQuestion_01_Description
data.value:
The Welsh government is committed to supporting quality assurance in public procurement. It is recommended that bidding organisations have a third-party certified quality management system (QMS), with appropriate scope, where required. This module aims to understand how a bidding organisation ensures product and service quality management.

You are only required to complete this module if requested by the contracting authority you are bidding for.

Failure to complete this module may result in your tenders being deemed insufficient.

The information you'll need

You'll need to provide information on quality management in your organisation including:
  • the accrediting body of your QMS certification
  • the standard (ISO 9001 or equivalent) assessed against
  • whether you have documented processes for ensuring product quality

data.name: QualityManagementQuestion_02_Title
data.value: Do you operate in accordance with a quality management system that is certified by a UKAS-accredited (or national equivalent) third party against ISO 9001 or an equivalent standard?

data.name: QualityManagementQuestion_02_Description
data.value: View the United Kingdom Accreditation Service website (opens in a new tab) to find out more about UKAS accreditation.

data.name: QualityManagementQuestion_03_Title
data.value: Do you want to upload evidence of your quality management system certification now?

data.name: QualityManagementQuestion_03_CustomInsetText
data.value: If you are successful you must be in a position to provide evidence if required, prior to contract award, and without delay.

data.name: QualityManagementQuestion_04_Title
data.value: Do you have a documented process designed to ensure that the quality of your products or services is consistent?

data.name: EnvironmentalQuestion_01_Description
data.value:
For some procurements it may be necessary for bidders to provide information on their environmental management system (EMS) and its certification standard. An EMS is a set of processes that help an organisation to reduce its environmental impact. Your contracting authority will provide you with specific requirements that your EMS must meet.

You are only required to complete this module if requested by the contracting authority you are bidding for.

Failure to complete this module may result in your tenders being deemed insufficient.

The information you'll need

You'll need to provide information on your environmental management policies and systems. This may include:
  • confirmation you have an EMS certified by a UKAS-accredited organisation or equivalent
  • information about your environmental policy statement

data.name: EnvironmentalQuestion_02_Title
data.value: Do you operate in accordance with an environmental management system (EMS) that is certified by a UKAS-accredited (or national equivalent) organisation?

data.name: EnvironmentalQuestion_02_CustomInsetText
data.value: If you are successful you must be in a position to provide evidence if required, prior to contract award, and without delay.

data.name: EnvironmentalQuestion_03_Title
data.value: Do you want to upload evidence of your environmental management system (EMS) certification now?

data.name: EnvironmentalQuestion_03_CustomInsetText
data.value: If you are successful you must be in a position to provide evidence if required, prior to contract award, and without delay.

data.name: EnvironmentalQuestion_04_Title
data.value: Do you have an environmental policy statement committing your organisation to a programme of improvement?

data.name: EnvironmentalQuestion_05_Title
data.value: Do you want to upload evidence of your environmental policy statement certification now?

data.name: EnvironmentalQuestion_05_CustomInsetText
data.value: If you are successful you must be in a position to provide evidence if required, prior to contract award, and without delay.

data.name: WelshHealthAndSafetyQuestion_01_Title
data.value: Submitting your health and safety information

data.name: WelshHealthAndSafetyQuestion_01_Description
data.value:
Health and safety regulations ensure the well-being of employees and the public in the workplace. Some tenders may require you to provide information relating to health and safety compliance, risk and processes in your organisation.

You are only required to complete this module if requested by the contracting authority you are bidding for.

Failure to complete this module may result in your tenders being deemed insufficient.

The information you'll need

You'll need to provide health and safety information related to your organisation. This may include:
  • health and safety enforcement or remedial orders including those of any connected person
  • industrial or occupational safety group membership details (where relevant)
  • health and safety policy details
  • nominated personnel for health and safety advice
  • confirmation of your processes to manage hazardous chemicals

data.name: WelshHealthAndSafetyQuestion_02_Title
data.value: Has your organisation been in receipt of enforcement/remedial orders in relation to the Health and Safety Executive (or equivalent body) in the last three years?

data.name: WelshHealthAndSafetyQuestion_03_Title
data.value: Provide details of the enforcement and remedial orders served

data.name: WelshHealthAndSafetyQuestion_03_Description
data.value: Provide details of any remedial action or changes to procedures you have made as a result, or indicate that you plan to provide this later

data.name: WelshHealthAndSafetyQuestion_04_Title
data.value: Are you registered with an industrial or occupational safety group?

data.name: WelshHealthAndSafetyQuestion_04_Description
data.value:
For example, a member of SSIP or equivalent.

If you select ‘Yes’, you will need to provide details of your registration

data.name: WelshHealthAndSafetyQuestion_05_Title
data.value: Provide your membership number, your membership level, and other details of what your registration covers

data.name: WelshHealthAndSafetyQuestion_05_03_Title
data.value: Other details of what your registration covers

data.name: WelshHealthAndSafetyQuestion_06_Title
data.value: Is your organisation registered with an industrial or occupational safety group?

data.name: WelshHealthAndSafetyQuestion_06_Description
data.value:
For example, a member of SSIP or equivalent.

If you select ‘Yes’, you will need to provide details of your organisation’s registration

data.name: WelshHealthAndSafetyQuestion_07_Title
data.value: Provide your organisation’s membership number, membership level, and other details of what the registration covers

data.name: WelshHealthAndSafetyQuestion_07_03_Title
data.value: Other details of what your registration covers

data.name: WelshHealthAndSafetyQuestion_08_01_Title
data.value: Confirm that your organisation has a health and safety policy

data.name: WelshHealthAndSafetyQuestion_08_01_Description
data.value:
This should include:

  • a policy statement – signed and dated
  • the organisation and responsibilities – how health and safety requirements are implemented
  • the arrangements – standards and procedures adopted in practice

data.name: WelshHealthAndSafetyQuestion_08_Title
data.value: Do you want to upload evidence of your organisation’s health and safety policy now?

data.name: WelshHealthAndSafetyQuestion_08_CustomInsetText
data.value: If you are successful you must be in a position to provide evidence if required, prior to contract award, and without delay.

data.name: WelshHealthAndSafetyQuestion_09_Title
data.value: Confirm that your health and safety policy has been reviewed within the past two years

data.name: WelshHealthAndSafetyQuestion_10_01_Title
data.value: Do you have a nominated competent person responsible for health and safety advice?

data.name: WelshHealthAndSafetyQuestion_10_01_Description
data.value:
What is competence?
Competence can be described as the combination of training, skills, experience and knowledge that a person has and their ability to apply them to perform a task safely. For more information read what is competence? (opens in a new tab).

data.name: WelshHealthAndSafetyQuestion_10_Title
data.value: Do you want to upload evidence of your nominated competent person now?

data.name: WelshHealthAndSafetyQuestion_10_CustomInsetText
data.value: If you are successful, you must be able to provide evidence, if required, prior to contract award. For example, CVs and copies of qualification certificates relevant to the role of health and safety advisor.

data.name: WelshHealthAndSafetyQuestion_11_01_Title
data.value: Confirm that you have arrangements in place to manage chemicals used under the Control of Substances Hazardous to Health (COSHH) Regulations

data.name: WelshHealthAndSafetyQuestion_11_01_CustomInsetText
data.value: If you are successful you must be in a position to provide evidence if required, prior to contract award, and without delay.

data.name: WelshHealthAndSafetyQuestion_11_Title
data.value: Do you want to provide evidence that you have arrangements to manage chemicals under COSHH regulations now?

data.name: WelshHealthAndSafetyQuestion_11_CustomInsetText
data.value: If you are successful you must be in a position to provide evidence if required, prior to contract award, and without delay.

data.name: WelshHealthAndSafetyQuestion_Group5_SummaryTitle
data.value: Your organisation's safety group membership details

data.name: HealthAndSafetyQuestion_01_Title
data.value: Submitting your health and safety information

data.name: HealthAndSafetyQuestion_01_Description
data.value:
Health and safety regulations ensure the well-being of employees and the public in the workplace. Some tenders may require you to provide information about your health and safety policies, risk assessments, and training provided to prevent accidents and injuries.

You are only required to complete this module if requested by the contracting authority you are bidding for. Failure to complete this module may result in your tenders being deemed insufficient where health and safety information is required.

The information you'll need

You'll need to provide information about your organisation's health and safety management and risk procedures.

data.name: HealthAndSafetyQuestion_02_Title
data.value: How do you manage health and safety?

data.name: HealthAndSafetyQuestion_02_Description
data.value:
Include examples of how you handle significant risks (like the use of contractors, where relevant).

If you would like to provide this information in a document format, enter “not applicable” below and continue to the next question.

data.name: HealthAndSafetyQuestion_03_Title
data.value: Do you have supporting documents to upload?

data.name: Exclusions_07_Title
data.value: Did this exclusion happen in the UK?

data.name: Exclusions_06_Description
data.value: Where the contracting authority can contact someone about the exclusion

data.name: Exclusions_05_Title
data.value: Describe the exclusion in more detail

data.name: Exclusions_05_Description
data.value: Give us your explanation of the event. For example, any background information you can give about what happened or what caused the exclusion.

data.name: Exclusions_04_Title
data.value: How the exclusion is being managed

data.name: Exclusions_04_Description
data.value:
You must tell us what you or the person who was subject to the event:

  • have done to prove it was taken seriously - for example, paid a fine or compensation
  • have done to stop the circumstances that caused it from happening again - for example, taking steps like changing staff or management or putting procedures or training in place
  • are doing to monitor the steps that were taken - for example, regular meetings

data.name: Exclusions_03_Title
data.value: Do you have a supporting document to upload?

data.name: Exclusions_03_Description
data.value: A decision from a public authority that was the basis for the offence. For example, documentation from the police, HMRC or the court.

data.name: Exclusions_03_Caption
data.value: Upload a file, You can upload most file types including: PDF, scans, mobile phone photos, Word, Excel and PowerPoint, multimedia and ZIP files that are smaller than 25MB.

data.name: Exclusions_02_Title
data.value: Have the circumstances that led to the exclusion ended?

data.name: Exclusions_02_Description
data.value: For example, a court decision for environmental misconduct led your organisation or the connected person to stop harming the environment.

data.name: Exclusions_02_Caption
data.value:
Enter the date the circumstances ended
For example, 27 3 2007

data.name: Exclusions_09_Title
data.value: Select who the exclusion applies to

data.name: Exclusions_09_Description
data.value: If it applies to someone not listed, you must go back to the ‘Add a connected person’ section and add them.

data.name: Exclusions_10_Title
data.value: Was the decision recorded on a public authority website?

data.name: Exclusions_10_Description
data.value: For example, the outcome of a court decision for a conviction or other event

data.name: Exclusions_08_Description
data.value:
Only select one exclusion. You can add another at the end if you need to.

If this exclusion happened outside the UK, select the equivalent offence in the UK for where it took place.

data.name: Exclusions_08_Options_Groups_01_Hint
data.value: Defined in schedule 6 of the Procurement Act 2023 (opens in new tab).

data.name: Exclusions_08_Options_Groups_01_Choices_01_Title
data.value: Adjustments for tax arrangements that are abusive

data.name: Exclusions_08_Options_Groups_01_Choices_03_Title
data.value: Defeat in respect of notifiable tax arrangements

data.name: Exclusions_08_Options_Groups_01_Choices_04_Title
data.value: Failure to cooperate with an investigation

data.name: Exclusions_08_Options_Groups_01_Choices_05_Title
data.value: Finding by HMRC, in exercise of its powers in respect of VAT, of abusive practice

data.name: Exclusions_08_Options_Groups_01_Choices_06_Title
data.value: Penalties for transactions connected with VAT fraud and evasion of tax or duty

data.name: Exclusions_08_Options_Groups_01_Choices_07_Title
data.value: Penalties payable for errors in tax documentation and failure to notify, and certain VAT and excise

data.name: Exclusions_08_Options_Groups_02_Hint
data.value: Defined in schedule 6 of the Procurement Act 2023 (opens in new tab).

data.name: Exclusions_08_Options_Groups_02_Choices_01_Title

data.name: Exclusions_08_Options_Groups_02_Choices_04_Title

data.name: Exclusions_08_Options_Groups_02_Choices_07_Title

data.name: Exclusions_08_Options_Groups_03_Hint
data.value: Defined in schedule 7 of the Procurement Act 2023 (opens in new tab).

data.name: Exclusions_08_Options_Groups_03_Choices_02_Title

data.name: Exclusions_08_Options_Groups_03_Choices_04_Title

data.name: Exclusions_08_Options_Groups_03_Choices_07_Title

data.name: Exclusions_08_Options_Groups_03_Choices_09_Title

data.name: Exclusions_Configuration_RemoveConfirmationHeading
data.value: Are you sure you want to remove this exclusion?

data.name: Exclusions_Configuration_FurtherQuestionsExemptedHeading

data.name: TradeAssurance_01_Description
data.value: Enter the name of the person or body. You can add another at the end if you need to. For example, Red Tractor Assurance or Quality Meat Scotland (QMS) Assurance.

data.name: TradeAssurance_02_Title
data.value: Do you know the reference number?

data.name: TradeAssurance_03_Title
data.value: What date was the trade assurance awarded?

data.name: TradeAssurances_Configuration_RemoveConfirmationHeading
data.value: Are you sure you want to remove this trade assurance?

data.name: TradeAssurances_Configuration_FurtherQuestionsExemptedHint
data.value: These are trade assurances for business and trade, not procurement specific. Adding them will provide confidence to contracting authorities and support any bids you submit. For example, Red Tractor Assurance covers food safety, traceability, animal welfare and environmental protection.

data.name: TradeAssurances_Configuration_FurtherQuestionsExemptedHeading

data.name: Global_YearInput_YearInvalidError
data.value: The year entered is invalid. Please enter a valid year.

data.name: ModernSlavery_01_Description
data.value:
Modern slavery refers to offences of slavery, servitude, forced labour and human trafficking. To address these crimes, the UK government has issued Procurement Policy Note (PPN) 009, which mandates that suppliers bidding for specific contracts demonstrate their commitment to addressing modern slavery.

You are only required to complete this module if requested by the contracting authority you are bidding for. Failure to complete this module may result in your tenders being deemed insufficient where PPN 009 has been applied. For more information read PPN 009: Tackling Modern Slavery in Government Supply Chains (opens in a new tab).

The information you'll need

You'll need to provide information on modern slavery and trafficking in relation to your organisation. This may include:
  • a link to or copy of your Modern Slavery Statement or equivalent documents
  • instructions on how to find your Modern Slavery Statement or equivalent documents
  • information you have included in your Modern Slavery Statement or equivalent documentation

data.name: ModernSlavery_02_Title
data.value: Are you a commercial organisation subject to Section 54 of the Modern Slavery Act 2015?

data.name: ModernSlavery_02_SummaryTitle
data.value: Subject to Section 54 Modern Slavery Act

data.name: ModernSlavery_02_Description
data.value:
For example, you are an organisation supplying goods or services that:
  • conducts business, or part of a business, in the UK
  • has an annual turnover of more than £36 million

For more information read section 54 of the Modern Slavery Act 2015 (opens in a new tab).

data.name: ModernSlavery_03_Title
data.value: Is your latest Modern Slavery Statement available digitally?

data.name: ModernSlavery_04_Title
data.value: Are your documents or statements related to modern slavery available digitally?

data.name: ModernSlavery_04_Description
data.value: Published statements or other relevant documents should contain information of a similar type and level to a Modern Slavery Statement.

data.name: ModernSlavery_05_Title
data.value: Enter the link to your Modern Slavery Statement

data.name: ModernSlavery_05_Description
data.value: This should be the link that is published on your organisation's website.

data.name: ModernSlavery_06_Title
data.value: Do you want to upload evidence of your latest Modern Slavery Statement now?

data.name: ModernSlavery_06_CustomInsetText
data.value: If you are successful you must be in a position to provide evidence if required, prior to contract award, and without delay.

data.name: ModernSlavery_07_Title
data.value: Enter the link to your relevant documentation or published statements on modern slavery

data.name: ModernSlavery_08_Title
data.value: Do you want to upload evidence of your latest Modern Slavery Statement now?

data.name: ModernSlavery_08_CustomInsetText
data.value: If you are successful you must be in a position to provide evidence if required, prior to contract award, and without delay.

data.name: ModernSlavery_09_Title
data.value: Enter instructions on how to find your organisation's Modern Slavery Statement

data.name: ModernSlavery_09_Description
data.value: This is the exact location online, for example, go to 'website link', scroll down to footer menu and click on 'policies'

data.name: ModernSlavery_10_Title
data.value: Enter instructions on how to find your relevant published statements or documents on modern slavery

data.name: ModernSlavery_10_Description
data.value: This is the exact location online, for example, go to 'website link', scroll down to footer menu and click on 'policies'

data.name: ModernSlavery_11_Description
data.value:
If the following information is missing from your statements or documents related to modern slavery, explain why and commit to including it before the contract is awarded:

  • organisation structure and supply chains
  • policies in relation to modern slavery and human trafficking
  • due diligence processes for modern slavery and human trafficking, including your supply chains
  • risk assessment and management plans
  • key performance indicators to measure the effectiveness of preventative steps being taken
  • training on modern slavery and trafficking available to staff

If all information is included in the statement indicate this in your response.

data.name: ModernSlavery_12_Description
data.value:
If the following information is missing from your Modern Slavery Statement or equivalent documents, explain why and commit to including it before the contract is awarded:

  • organisation structure and supply chains
  • policies in relation to modern slavery and human trafficking
  • due diligence processes for modern slavery and human trafficking, including your supply chains
  • risk assessment and management plans
  • key performance indicators to measure the effectiveness of preventative steps being taken
  • training on modern slavery and trafficking available to staff

If all information is included in the statement indicate this in your response.

data.name: DataProtection_01_Description
data.value:
Data protection involves safeguarding personal data from misuse, loss, or unauthorised access. This module focuses on compliance with data protection laws (such as GDPR) and how a supplier manages, stores, and processes personal information.

You are only required to complete this module if requested by the contracting authority you are bidding for. Failure to complete this module may result in your tenders being deemed insufficient where PPN 020 has been applied. For more information read PPN 020: Guidance on data protection legislation (opens in a new tab) .

The information you'll need

You'll need to provide information on data protection within your organisation. This may include your:
  • resource confirmation
  • facilities and measures in place to ensure compliance with data protection laws

data.name: DataProtection_02_Title
data.value: Do you have the resources to ensure compliance with UK GDPR?

data.name: DataProtection_02_Description
data.value: You should consider both your human and technical resources

data.name: DataProtection_02_Custom_Yes
data.value: Yes, I have the resources or will have the resources by contract award

data.name: DataProtection_02_Custom_No
data.value: No, I do not have the resources

data.name: DataProtection_03_Title
data.value: When will you have the resources to ensure compliance with UK GDPR?

data.name: DataProtection_03_Description
data.value: You should consider both your human and technical resources

data.name: DataProtection_03_Custom_No
data.value: I do not have the resources, but will have them by contract award

data.name: DataProtection_04_Title
data.value: How do you ensure compliance with UK data protection law?

data.name: DataProtection_04_Description
data.value:
Please provide details of the technical facilities and measures (including systems and processes) you have in place, or will have in place by contract award, to ensure compliance with UK data protection law and to ensure the protection of the rights of data subjects. Your response should include, but should not be limited to facilities and measures:
  • to ensure ongoing confidentiality, integrity, availability and resilience of processing systems and services;
  • to comply with the rights of data subjects in respect of receiving privacy information, and access, rectification, deletion and portability of personal data;
  • to ensure that any consent based processing meets standards of active, informed consent, and that such consents are recorded and auditable;
  • to ensure legal safeguards are in place to legitimise transfers of personal data outside the UK (if such transfers will take place); to maintain records of personal data processing activities; and to regularly test, assess and evaluate the effectiveness of the above measures.

If you would like to provide this information in a document format, enter “not applicable” below and continue to the next question

data.name: DataProtection_05_Title
data.value: Do you have supporting documents to upload?

data.name: CarbonNetZero_01_Title
data.value: Submitting your Carbon Net Zero information

data.name: CarbonNetZero_01_Description
data.value:
Carbon Net Zero is the commitment to balance greenhouse gas emissions with equivalent removals by 2050. In-scope organisations may be required to submit a Carbon Reduction Plan (CRP) when bidding for certain government contracts.

You are only required to complete this module if requested by the contracting authority you are bidding for. Failure to complete this module may result in your tenders being deemed insufficient where current policy has been applied.

The information you'll need

You'll need to provide information on your Carbon Reduction Plan. This may include:
  • the expiry date of your Carbon Reduction Plan
  • your Emissions Declaration
  • your baseline and reporting year data

data.name: CarbonNetZero_02_Title
data.value: Have you published a Carbon Reduction Plan which meets the required reporting standard?

data.name: CarbonNetZero_03_Title
data.value: Do you have a link to your most recently published Carbon Reduction Plan?

data.name: CarbonNetZero_NoCarbonReductionPlan_Description
data.value: To complete the Carbon Net Zero module you must have a published Carbon Reduction Plan.

data.name: CarbonNetZero_04_Title
data.value: Enter your Carbon Reduction Plan expiry date

data.name: CarbonNetZero_05_Title
data.value: Enter your Net Zero target year

data.name: CarbonNetZero_CarbonNetZeroDetails_NetZeroTargetYear_Heading
data.value: Enter your Net Zero target year

data.name: Payments_01_Description
data.value:
The Government has committed to tackling late payments as part of its Plan for Small Businesses. This module focuses on identifying the reliability of a supplier's payment systems, to ensure compliance with government payment policies and promote fair cash flow for businesses. For more information read PPN 015: Taking account of a supplier's approach to payment in the procurement of major contracts (opens in a new tab).

You are only required to complete this module if requested by the contracting authority you are bidding for. Failure to complete this module may result in your tenders being deemed insufficient where PPN 015 has been applied.

The information you'll need

You'll need to provide information on your payments and invoices. This may include:
  • compliance with your payment terms
  • payment and invoice details for the last two six month reporting periods
  • an action plan for reducing late payments (where relevant)

data.name: Payments_02_Title
data.value: Do you have processes to ensure you pay your supply chain on time?

data.name: Payments_02_Description
data.value: For example, within your agreed contractual terms

data.name: Payments_03_Title
data.value: Do you have processes to resolve disputed payments and invoices in your supply chain on time?

data.name: Payments_03_Description
data.value: For example, within your agreed contractual terms

data.name: Payments_04_Title
data.value: Confirmation of payment terms for public sector contracts

data.name: Payments_04_Description
data.value:
Confirm you have:

  • systems in place to include a minimum of 30-day payment terms in all your supply chain contracts
  • the requirment that these payment terms are passed down through your supply chain

data.name: Payments_05_Title
data.value: Do you report under the Payment Practices Reporting Regulations?

data.name: Payments_05_SummaryTitle
data.value: Reporting under the Payment Practices Reporting Regulations

data.name: Payments_05_Caption
data.value: Enter the link to your most recent report

data.name: Payments_06_Title
data.value: Payment and invoice reporting within your immediate supply chain

data.name: Payments_06_Description
data.value: Enter your payment and invoice details for your most recent 6 month reporting period.

data.name: Payments_06_AverageDaysToPayInvoice
data.value: Average number of days to pay an invoice

data.name: Payments_06_AverageDaysToPayInvoice_SummaryTitle
data.value: Average number of days to pay an invoice

data.name: Payments_07_Title
data.value: Payment and invoice reporting within your immediate supply chain

data.name: Payments_07_Description
data.value: Enter your payment and invoice details for the 6 month reporting period prior to your most recent reporting period.

data.name: Payments_07_AverageDaysToPayInvoice
data.value: Average number of days to pay an invoice

data.name: Payments_07_AverageDaysToPayInvoice_SummaryTitle
data.value: Average number of days to pay an invoice

data.name: Payments_08_Title
data.value: Explain why you have not paid all invoices within agreed contractual terms (where relevant)

data.name: Payments_08_SummaryTitle
data.value: Invoices not paid within contractual terms

data.name: Payments_08_Description
data.value: You do not need to complete this question if you have paid all invoices within agreed contract terms.

data.name: Payments_09_Title
data.value: Have you shown that 95% or more of your payable invoices have been paid?

data.name: Payments_09_Description
data.value:
Your invoices to suppliers must have been paid:

  • within 60 days of invoice receipt
  • in at least one of the last two 6 month reporting periods

data.name: Payments_10_Title
data.value: Can you confirm you have paid all your invoices within an average of 45 days?

data.name: Payments_10_Description
data.value: Your invoices to suppliers must have been paid within an average of 45 days in at least one of the last two 6 month reporting periods.

data.name: Payments_11_Description
data.value:
Your plan must include, as a minimum:

  • identification of the main causes of failure to pay 95% of all supply chain invoices paid within 60 days and overdue payments (where relevant)
  • actions to address the cause of each payment failure
  • commitment to a process for regular reporting on progress to the suppliers bidder's audit committee (or equivalent)
  • a plan signed off by your director
  • a plan published on your website (this can be a shorter, summary plan)

data.name: Payments_11_InsetText
data.value: You can submit an existing action plan prepared for a different purpose, but it must cover the points mentioned on this page.

data.name: ShareMyInformationConsortium_05_Description
data.value:
• I am authorised to make this declaration on behalf of the consortium and declare that to the best of my knowledge the answers submitted and information contained is correct and accurate at the time of declaration.

  • I declare that, upon request from the Contracting Authority and without delay I will provide the certificates or documentary evidence referred to in this information.

  • I understand that the information is required as per the regulations of the Procurement Act 2023 and may be used in the selection process to assess my suitability to participate further in this procurement.

  • I understand that a contracting authority with whom this information is shared may request further clarity or detail on information provided in this submission.

data.value: Your name as the person authorised to declare the supplier information.

data.name: ShareMyInformation_02_Description
data.value: So the contracting authority can contact you.

data.name: ShareMyInformation_04_Description
data.value: Your name as the person authorised to declare the supplier information.

data.name: ShareMyInformation_05_Description
data.value:
• I am authorised to make this declaration on behalf of the supplier and declare that to the best of my knowledge the answers submitted and information contained is correct and accurate at the time of declaration.
  • I declare that, upon request from the Contracting Authority and without delay I will provide the certificates or documentary evidence referred to in this information.
  • I understand that the information is required as per the regulations of the Procurement Act 2023 and may be used in the selection process to assess my suitability to participate further in this procurement.
  • I understand that a contracting authority with whom this information is shared may request further clarity or detail on information provided in this submission.

data.name: ShareMyInformation_01_Description

data.name: WelshExclusions_01_Description
data.value:
'Blacklisting' or the use of prohibited lists to deny individuals employment opportunities is known to have been used by construction companies operating in Wales. The 'blacklisting' of individuals is an unlawful practice, and legislation has been put in place to ban its use. This module aims to identify organisations that have engaged in 'blacklisting' activity.

You are only required to complete this module if requested by the contracting authority you are bidding for.

Failure to complete this module may result in your tenders being deemed insufficient.

The information you'll need

You'll need to declare if you or your company has been found to engage in 'blacklisting' and provide the following details where relevant:
  • date of conviction
  • judicial decision
  • Self-cleaning measures (where applicable)

data.name: WelshExclusions_02_Title
data.value: Have you, or has your organisation, been found to have employed the practice of 'blacklisting' in the last three years?

data.name: WelshExclusions_02_SummaryTitle
data.value: Blacklisting within the last three years

data.name: WelshExclusions_02_Description
data.value:
What is 'blacklisting'?
'Blacklisting', or use of prohibited lists, is the unlawful practice of gathering information on employees on their Trade Union membership and related activities, in order to discriminate against them.

data.name: WelshExclusions_03_Title
data.value: Provide details of blacklisting breaches within the last three years

data.name: WelshExclusions_03_Description
data.value:
This should include:
  • date of the conviction(s)
  • if the blacklisting breach was confirmed by a judicial decision that is final and binding

data.name: WelshExclusions_04_Title
data.value: Describe the 'self-cleaning' measures you have taken to demonstrate your reliability

data.name: WelshExclusions_04_Description
data.value: Read more about 'self-cleaning' in Procurement Act 2023 exclusions guidance (opens in a new tab).

data.name: WelshSteel_01_Description
data.value:
The following module refers to the procurement and use of steel products in Welsh government projects. It focuses on compliance with UK regulations regarding sourcing, quality, and sustainability. For further information read.

You are only required to complete this module if requested by the contracting authority you are bidding for.

Failure to complete this module may result in your tenders being deemed insufficient.

The information you'll need

You'll need to provide information on steel specific, supply chain projects or programmes. This may include relevant examples of your:
  • management systems, policies, standards and procedures
  • compliance with relevant legislation
  • sustainable practices
  • compliance with Section 7 of the Procurement Act 2023, paragraphs 7 to 9
  • health and safety policies and training in your supply chain

data.name: WelshSteel_02_SummaryTitle
data.value: Steel supply chain management - Document upload

data.name: WelshSteel_02_Description
data.value:
For contracts which relate to projects or programmes with a value of £3 million or more, you must provide details of steel specific supply chain management systems, policies, standards and procedures you have in place to ensure robust supply chain management.

Do you want to upload these details as a document?

data.name: WelshSteel_02_CustomInsetText
data.value: If you choose not to upload your details as a document, you will need to provide them as text on the next page or confirm that you plan to provide them later.

data.name: WelshSteel_03_Description
data.value:
For contracts which relate to projects or programmes with a value of £3 million or more, describe the steel specific supply chain management systems, policies, standards and procedures you have in place to ensure robust supply chain management.

If you do not have the details now but plan to provide them later, indicate this in your response

data.name: WelshSteel_04_Description
data.value:
Provide details of previous similar projects where you have demonstrated a high level of competency in managing all supply chain members involved in steel supply or production to ensure a sustainable and resilient supply of steel.

Do you want to upload these details as a document

data.name: WelshSteel_04_CustomInsetText
data.value: If you choose not to upload your details as a document, you will need to provide them as text on the next page or confirm that you plan to provide them later.

data.name: WelshSteel_05_Description
data.value:
Provide details of previous similar projects where you have demonstrated a high level of competency in managing all supply chain members involved in steel supply or production to ensure a sustainable and resilient supply of steel.

If you do not have the details now but plan to provide them later, indicate this in your response

data.name: WelshSteel_06_Description
data.value: Do you take steps to ensure that members of your supply chain do not make agreements with other economic operators aimed at distorting competition as described in Schedule 7 of the Procurement Act 2023, paragraphs 7-9?

data.name: WelshSteel_06_Caption
data.value: Provide a brief outline of the steps you take, or indicate that you plan to provide this later

data.name: WelshSteel_07_Description
data.value:
Do you take steps to ensure that all members of your supply chain have in place appropriate health and safety policies dealing with at least the following:

  • a policy statement that is signed and dated
  • the organisation and responsibilities such as how health and safety requirements are implemented and
  • the arrangements including standards and procedures adopted in practice
  • and that this is reviewed at least every 2 years

data.name: WelshSteel_07_Caption
data.value: Provide a brief outline of the steps you take, or indicate that you plan to provide this later

data.name: WelshSteel_08_Description
data.value: Do you take steps to ensure that all members of your supply chain provide appropriate health and safety training, particularly for workers carrying out potentially hazardous tasks?

data.name: WelshSteel_08_Caption
data.value: Provide a brief outline of the steps you take, or indicate that you plan to provide this later
